Message.Title: YHOO Marching on to $40/Share......then to $100 - My Top 10 Reasons
Message.Msg: Like I said in my previous post - going to $40 and then straight to $100. My Top 10 reasons: 1) New Mobile Co. purchases = more Mobile developers. FYI, mobile developers are probably the hardest employees to find. Yahoo will dominate this space by securing as much mobile talent as possible. 2) Alibaba, Alibaba and Alibaba - enuf said. 3) Yahoo Japan & bet on the Yen. 4) On going pruning of their employee ranks. For all the lazy Yahooligans - no soup for you! G'bye. 5) Stock Repurchase - you are starting to see the effects. Yahoo is purchasing their stock back on a daily, weekly basis. Less Stock = high prices quickly when the demand increases. Pure math. Just look at the recent price increases. Nominal to low volume, bigger jumps, higher highs. 6) Yahoo will become a Media Power House! While everybody is focusing on Search, I'm focusing on their growing content. Think NBC, ABC and CBS and A&E......lol. Not just a search for your next vacation info. Yeah I know I'm throwing in a little hyperbole in this item. But then again.... 7) A bet on Mobile - this is a big bet and they will win and dominate. Let Microsoft worry about the PC's, and let Google worry about their new glasses that nobody will wear out on the streets. Yahoo will focus on what matters. 8) Marissa M. - she will continue to lead and "Lean Forward" - her charisma, charm and looks is worth at least another $10/share premium! LOL....I do believe it's true. Compare her to Balmer...who would YOU believe and buy from? Can she be the "Steve Jobs" that came back to resurrect Apple when it was dying? I say yes! 9) Revenues are KILLING all the pundits/experts predictions! Yes, one can say that their display ad rev. is down....but I say stop looking at the tree, look at the forest. The will continue to smash their #'s. 10) Next BIG purchase = more revenue. HULU? Good luck all LONGS!!! Yes, call me nuts. :

Topic.Title: YHOO Marching on to $40/Share......then to $100 - My Top 10 Reasons

Message.Msg: By the way I forgot to mention....my non-scientific crystal ball tells me that the excitement is just getting started. Lots of press on a daily basis, WSJ, Bloomberg, and CNBC. It's like getting free commercial air time. MM is purchasing a new company at a ferocious pace. The REAL excitement will come when you see this question on this board....."What price will YAHOO do a split? Do you think MM will split the stock and will she let it go higher just like GOOGLE and Apple? When you start seeing "stock split questions" pop up more and more....you know the excitement for YHOO is showing lots of momentum. Why? Because people usually ask this question when the stock is at a healthy number......like $50 to $100/share. LOL.....again, I could be wrong, there are many experts smarter than me on this board.....but all I need is to be correct once. : Loading up the truck, good luck to all longs!

Topic.Title: YHOO Marching on to $40/Share......then to $100 - My Top 10 Reasons

Message.Msg: Oh, you have one crystal ball as well. A split... hmmm. when was the last time any company did a split? I have no idea, but it's been awhile - not like 15 or 20 yrs ago. The bank and utilities used to split consistently because investors were not as savvy & would not pay above a certain price point for the stock. If there is no buyout in the next 24 months - I could see the stock above $50, but I don't see why she would do a split - Yahoo - and all public co's for that matter - could give a rat's patout about individual investors. Look at Apple, Google, Amazon. I don't care either way, I would just be happy to see the stock at a price where there would even need to be a discussion re a split. Yes, there are lots of professionals on the board (~~, do you really think they are smarter than you though?

Message.Title: SHOCK: Next Week Yahoo will command 11% of Mobile Search in U.S.
Message.Msg: According to Statcounter Yahoo started the year with a 8.17% of US market share on mobile search, as of Today it has a 10.83%. At this rate it will achieve 11% this next week, and next November it will have 20% of US mobile search market. The growth rate has accelerated since the launch of the mail and yahoo application from a daily growth of 1.8% to an impressive 5% daily growth. On the other hand desktop search is decreasing a little bit, as it started the year with a 8.74% of the US market, topped to 9.69% in March, and now has decreased to 8.83% this last week. Remember this market gain is in top of the huge growth of mobile search! Impressive. This info is original and you will not see it anywhere else yet!

Topic.Title: YHOO Marching on to $40/Share......then to $100 - My Top 10 Reasons

Message.Msg: Many thanks for the positive feedback....I blush. Hahahaha.....I'll be truly happy if I get 7 out of the 10 points correct. On an interesting note look at he old charts about 10 years ago. Not positive what made it shot uo to over $100 but it did. This time yhoo will do it with exponentially more revenue from the sum of all parts and we will do it with so much less shares because of the buy back program. The bottom line, if Yhoo starts to show continual growth especially new growth in Ad revenue...watch out. I've never seen a volcano erupt but this will be as close as it gets. Right now the general public still thinks of Yhoo as that old Internet company, they got a new CEO but same ole same ole. By the time they smell the coffe and understand the true picture the stock will be at $40. Lol...good luck longs. Just hold and enjoy the Bi-monthly Yhoo news.
